result.execSummary:
The defendant Chavis Cortez Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: $569.00 payable to Janet F., Cash bail applied.

Provide DNA sample; pay surcharge. Pay all mandatory costs, assessment, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the DOC's. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
- No contact with firearms. 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

- Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued  programming.
- AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
- Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
- NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.

timeConds.notes: STAYED pending a review on 01-08-16 at 1:15pm, Br-38

supervisions.notes: Pay all mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges during period of probation in Count 1, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply. Defendant to report by 09-25-15 at NOON

records.addlTxt: Defendant Chavis Cortez Johnson in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $556.00 entered as ordered by the court on 10/07/15 to pay $60.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 08/01/16. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.
Order for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs in the amount of $563.00 signed and filed.
Bail Refund Check Packet

Defendant Chavis Cortez Johnson in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to negotiations, the REPEATER enhancers are deleted.
As to both counts:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
AS to count 1:    Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.
The court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction,  with credit for 0 days time served. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve 30 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 1-8-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.
-Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.  Court ordered that all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, as to count 2 be paid during this period of probation.
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
-Restitution is set at 569.00 payable to Janet F., cash bail on deposit to be applied to restitution.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
RECEIVED & FILED:  Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.
AS to count 2:    The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 1 day time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply.  Defendant to report by 9-25-2015 at NOON.  Court ordered that all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, are to be paid during probation in count 2, failure to pay will result in civil judgment.
Defense counsel to advise of appeal rights.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Chavis Cortez Johnson in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case is adjourned to 9-21-2015 at 1:15 for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Chavis Cortez Johnson in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Off the record.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 38 on 8-18-2015 at 1:30 pm.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  mld

Defendant Chavis Cortez Johnson in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Amended offer was provided to defense, per the State.  Case adjourned for Plea Hearing in Branch 4 on 7-16-2015 at 1:30 pm.   All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Janet F., or her children, MJF and DMF., and no violatios of the law, until further order of the Court.    mld
signed and filed.   mld

Defendant Chavis Cortez Johnson in court.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
FILE NOT IN COURT.
Defendant appeared pro-se.  Defendant's petition for appointment of counsel GRANTED by the court.  Case passed.  

Defendant Ronnie Ray Watson appeared in court with Attorney Christopher Ertl.  Kristen M. Schrak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court appoints counsel for defendant.  Attorney Christopher Ertl accepts appointment.  Order signed and filed.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $60.00 per month upon the conclusion of case, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  

Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-2-2015 at 1:30 pm.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Janet F., or her children, and no violations of the law, until further order of the Court.   mld

Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant previously posted bail in Whitefish Bay.  Balance due is -0-
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Janet F. and her children, MJF and DMF

Defendant Chavis Cortez Johnson in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Chavis Cortez Johnson in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT MAY QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04/15/2015
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Chavis Cortez Johnson not in court.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ORIGINAL COURT FILE IS UNAVAILABLE - COURT RECORD ENTRY IS MADE IN A DUPLICATE FILE.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.

Defendant Chavis Cortez Johnson not in court.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  State requests warrant be withdrawn.  Court grants request.
